snippet: Ann Pettway admitted taking 3-week-old Carlina White from Harlem Hospital and told a judge, “I got back on the train and went home.”
abstract: Ann Pettway pleads guilty to kidnapping 3-week-old Carlina White from New York City's Harlem Hospital in 1987 and raising her for 23 years as her own daughter; Federal District Court Judge Kevin P Castel emphasizes that his May sentencing decision does not have to follow guidelines recommended by federal prosecutors under the plea arrangement and that he can legally impose a life sentence.
lead_paragraph: Ann Pettway admitted taking 3-week-old Carlina White from Harlem Hospital and told a judge, “I got back on the train and went home.”

headline.seo: Woman Pleads Guilty in ’87 Harlem Hospital Abduction
headline.main: Guilty Plea in ’87 Kidnapping May Bring Life Sentence
headline.print_headline: Guilty Plea in ’87 Kidnapping May Bring Life Sentence
